intro: Soroseris hookeriana subsp. hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's soroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
